examples: Her behavior toward her colleagues was unprofessional.
She left him for a colleague.
John introduced his wife to his colleagues at the company dinner party.
The experienced lawyer is streets ahead of her young colleagues, with a deep understanding of the law and years of courtroom experience.
The two colleagues worked together closely and, over time, developed a strong rapport.
words.defineEn: someone with whom one works
words.defineVi: một người mà một người làm việc

examples: Friends shared a platter of crispy chicken wings with tangy dipping sauces at the sports bar.
The new student quickly made friends with the other musicians, because birds of a feather flock together.
My friends enjoyed tangy barbecue gammon skewers at the summer barbecue.
My friend prefers a vegetarian sandwich with avocado and sprouts.
My friends enjoyed smoky beef rib chops at the countryside barbecue.
words.defineEn: someone we know well, like a lot, and trust, but normally they are not part of our family
words.defineVi: một người mà chúng ta biết rõ, rất thích và tin tưởng, nhưng thông thường họ không phải là một phần của gia đình chúng ta

words.defineEn: to deny a statement
words.defineVi: để từ chối một tuyên bố

examples: We discuss current scientific advancements and discoveries in science class.
We discussed what punishment should be given to the boys.
We discussed our favorite movie scenes with our friends after watching a film.
The doctor made a call to the patient to discuss the test results.
The parents attended the school meeting to discuss their child's progress.
words.defineEn: to talk or have a discussion about something with someone
words.defineVi: để nói chuyện hoặc có một cuộc thảo luận về một cái gì đó với một ai đó

examples: She shares her eraser with her classmates during exams.
Can I introduce you to my classmates?
She lends her pencil to a classmate who forgot to bring one.
The student submitted her term paper early, beating her classmates to the punch and impressing her professor with her diligence and quality of work.
He had to work hard to keep up with his classmates in the advanced math course.
words.defineEn: someone who is or was in the same class as you at school or college
words.defineVi: ai đó đang hoặc đã học cùng lớp với bạn ở trường hoặc đại học

words.defineEn: a friend that one has a strong relationship with
words.defineVi: một người bạn mà người ta có một mối quan hệ mạnh mẽ với

examples: Lots of couples have problems in the first year of marriage.
The couple spent their vacation in a cozy cabin, billing and cooing by the fireplace.
Finally the couple may be celebrating a birthday, a wedding anniversary or some other red-letter day.
The couple in the flat upstairs are always at it hammer and tongs.
A couple of years in the army should make a man of him.
words.defineEn: two people who are married or having a romantic relationship
words.defineVi: hai người đã kết hôn hoặc có một mối quan hệ lãng mạn

examples: When planning their wedding, Michael and his fiancé took their event planner's advice on the venue, catering, and decorations.
Julia's fiancé left her at the altar, causing her immense heartbreak and embarrassment.
She and her fiance are raising two grandchildren between them, also because of substance addiction.
She and her fiance are raising two grandchildren between them, also because of substance addiction.
I had texted my fiance, and it was a big jumbled mess, and that's when he pretty much
words.defineEn: a man who is engaged to someone
words.defineVi: một người đàn ông đã đính hôn với ai đó

examples: John's family had concerns about his fiancée, suspecting she might be a gold digger who was after his inheritance.
Andrew Morton, a royal biographer, said Prince Harry's fiancee will pick up the baton from Princess Diana because Markle's age of 36 is the same as Princess Diana's when she passed away in 1997.
My success is largely attributable to my fiancee.
Tommy Wolikow and his fiancee, Rochelle Carlisle, met while working at the factory.
And, alas, she played Bianca, the girlfriend or fiancee of Chris.
words.defineEn: a woman who is engaged to someone
words.defineVi: một người phụ nữ đã đính hôn với ai đó

words.defineEn: a person whom one shares a room or apartment with
words.defineVi: một người mà một người chia sẻ một căn phòng hoặc căn hộ với

examples: His partner left the table in a fit of pique.
The diamond thief double-crossed his partners and gave them only worthless fake jewels.
We're really more like partners.
Ach partner is entitled to share in the profits of the business.
His business partner is holding the fort while he is away.
words.defineEn: the person that you are married to or having a romantic relationship with
words.defineVi: người mà bạn đã kết hôn hoặc có một mối quan hệ lãng mạn với

examples: The committee meets once a fortnight.
The car met the bus head-on.
He met his death in 1946.
I meet my study group at the library on Tuesday afternoons.
We usually meet at the coffee shop on Fridays.
words.defineEn: to come together in a place with others to do something special
words.defineVi: đến với nhau ở một nơi với những người khác để làm điều gì đó đặc biệt

examples: A new law is proposed to curb this type of blatantly dishonest description, and not before time
Because of the proposed merger, the company is standing at the crossroads.
He also casts his eye over the proposed law changes.

We should take the lead in proposing a compromise and be ready to give ground on several points.
words.defineEn: to ask a person to marry one
words.defineVi: để yêu cầu một người kết hôn với một

examples: Military leaders took over the government.
A true leader walks the talk.
At one stroke, the country lost two outstanding leaders.
The leaders of this war have the blood of many thousands of people on their hands.
Support for the leader was fraying at the edges.
words.defineEn: a person who leads or commands others
words.defineVi: một người lãnh đạo hoặc chỉ huy người khác

examples: In 2018 the party had 10 000 members.
All members of the band equally share the band's profits.
In the wake of the scandal, several committee members resigned.
The company's recent collapse has left their pension fund members up the creek.
The members of the band are like peas in a pod.
words.defineEn: someone or something that is in a specific group, club, or organization
words.defineVi: ai đó hoặc cái gì đó trong một nhóm, câu lạc bộ hoặc tổ chức cụ thể

examples: We are on the threshold of a new era in global relations.
She was charged in relation to a hit and run after she allegedly left the scene of an accident.
The two sides have been at daggers drawn for some months now with no sign of improvement in relations.
Relations with yourself, relationships with others, and improving those.
'You have no relations apart from Mrs. Reed?'
words.defineEn: a person who is related to someone by blood or marriage
words.defineVi: một người có liên quan đến một người nào đó bằng máu hoặc hôn nhân

examples: The town is three miles away.
The kangaroo was making mincemeat of him.
Many more businesses are feeling the chill wind of the recession.
The universal language of art is bridging a divide.
Then again, some major thinkers are way ahead of the curve.
words.defineEn: used when naming, or giving description or information about people, things, or situations
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi đặt tên hoặc đưa ra mô tả hoặc thông tin về người, sự vật hoặc tình huống

examples: Together, the ant colony was greater than the sum of its parts.
They play the guitar together during jam sessions.

They did everything together.
They stayed together for the sake of the children.
words.defineEn: in a way that two or multiple things are combined or in contact with each other
words.defineVi: theo cách mà hai hoặc nhiều thứ được kết hợp hoặc tiếp xúc với nhau

examples: The unexpected challenges became grist for the mill of their problem-solving skills.
Short hair really becomes you.
The child will become an adult.
The new office block has become an expensive white elephant.
The old government program has become a sacred cow.
words.defineEn: to start or grow to be
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu hoặc phát triển để được

examples: The book dealer would not break up the set.
John still carries a torch for Mary, even though they broke up years ago.
The music festival was a great way to break up the long winter months and add some excitement to our lives.
Rob has had the cockroach ever since Gloria broke up with him.
Rob has been down in the mouth ever since Gloria broke up with him.
words.defineEn: to end a relationship, typically a romantic or sexual one
words.defineVi: để kết thúc một mối quan hệ, điển hình là một mối quan hệ lãng mạn hoặc tình dục

examples: She often gets on her soapbox about environmental issues.
she gets on the stick very quickly.
It really gets on my nerves.
They got on bad terms after an argument.
Don't get on your high horse with me.
words.defineEn: to develop or perform in a positive or successful way
words.defineVi: để phát triển hoặc thực hiện một cách tích cực hoặc thành công

words.phonetic: tə ɡɛt tə noʊ ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ
words.defineEn: to become familiar with someone or something by spending time with them and learning about them

examples: They were young and they often went out together.

They went out together quite a lot, and he came to Carol's parents' house twice, and then last week Carol went to her father and said, 'I'm going to marry George Watts, Daddy.
words.defineEn: to be in a sexual or romantic relationship
words.defineVi: ở trong một mối quan hệ tình dục hoặc lãng mạn

words.defineEn: to be no longer in contact with a friend or acquaintance
words.defineVi: không còn liên lạc với bạn bè hoặc người quen
